headline: Lam Research Projects Strong FY26, But China-Driven Growth Faces Market Skepticism
summary: Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX) delivered stronger-than-expected earnings and raised its full-year guidance, driven by robust demand from China that defied broader industry headwinds. However, despite the upbeat tone and improved outlook, shares of the chipmaking equipment giant fell more than 5% in Thursday trading, as investors questioned the durability of growth driven largely by a geopolitically sensitive region. In its fiscal fourth quarter, Lam reported adjusted earnings of $1.33 per share on r

headline: Lam Research, Qualcomm, FormFactor, Applied Materials, and KLA Corporation Shares Are Falling, What You Need To Know
summary: A number of stocks fell in the afternoon session after a series of divergent earnings reports highlighted a clear split in the semiconductor industry, with investors rewarding companies exposed to the AI boom while punishing those tied to slowing consumer electronics and manufacturing equipment markets.

headline: Norwegian Cruise Line pops, Lam Research slips, Reddit earnings
summary: Here are some of the stories Wall Street is watching on Thursday, July 31. Shares of Norwegian Cruise Line (NCLH) are popping on sales growth and upbeat comments about bookings Lam Research (LRCX) is falling on concerns about demand from China. Reddit (RDDT) shares are jumping ahead of its Q2 report, set to be released after the market close. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Summit downgrades Lam Research on limited catalysts beyond 2025
summary: Investing.com -- Summit Insights downgraded Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX) to Hold from Buy, saying while the chip equipment maker continues to benefit from strong demand in 2025, wafer fabrication equipment (WFE) spending is likely to moderate in 2026.
